title: What kind of songs are called folk songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Good question. But what are ‘folk songs’ ? Back in my schooldays, around the time of rise to prominence of Bob Dylan, Pete Seeger, Peter, Paul and Mary, Joan Baez and others, much of THEIR output came to be known as ‘folk music’. However, I had come to regard ‘folk songs’ as timeless songs, handed down from generation to generation, such as (in England) “The Ash Grove”, “Strawberry Fair”, “Cherry Ripe”, “Oranges and Lemons” or (in Ireland) “She Moved Through The Fair”, “The Ballad of Molly Malone (Cockles and Muscles)” In USA, Mickey Newberry combined three folk songs - “Dixie”, “Battle Hymn Of The Republic”, and “All My Trials”, to form his “American Trilogy”, which became a ‘hit’ for Elvis Presley.

Folk music includes both traditional music and the genre that evolved from it during the 20th century folk revival. The term originated in the 19th century, but is often applied to music older than that. Some types of folk music are also called world music. Traditional folk music has been defined in several ways: as music transmitted orally, music with unknown composers, or music performed by custom over a long period of time. It has been contrasted with commercial and classical styles.

Uncomplicated (non orchestral) music that tells a story. A good example is “M.T.A.” by The Kingston Trio. The story is about a man named Charlie who is a nickel short to get a transfer on the moving Boston train, and is unable to get off until he pays. But did he ever return?No he never returned and his fate is still unlearned (poor old Charlie)He may ride forever 'neath the streets of BostonHe's the man who never returned Folk song.
The song which defines the country styles ,the living,food,regional family living,friends etc, the song defines the artistic culture of a particular region
Any early Mumford & Sons song, earlier Laura Marling, The Lumineers to some degree, some of The Lake Poets, The Head and the Heart, and Sons of the East.
Examples: Christmas Songs, mostly popular songs (classic) Hope this helps.
